item.title: Tales of the Shire: A The Lord of the Rings Game delayed to July 29
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/tales-of-the-shire-a-the-lord-of-the-rings-game-delayed-to-july-29

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out on March 25.

Publisher Private Division and developer Weta Workshop have delayed single-player life simulation game Tales of the Shire: A The Lord of the Rings Game from its previously planned March 25 release window to July 29. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Here is the full message from Weta Workshop on the delay:

Dear Fellow Hobbits,

A good Hobbit feast takes time, and so does Tales of the Shire! We’re taking a little longer to ensure that every Hobbit, on every platform, can enjoy the same cozy experience. The game will now launch on July 29, 2025.

We want this game to feel like a warm hug from Middle-earth, and we are making sure that no matter where you play, you’ll feel right at home in The Shire. From foot-hair styles to the fluffiest cakes, every detail will be just right.

We appreciate your patience and cannot wait for you to experience life in The Shire this summer. In the meantime, arrange the table, polish your silver and get ready for a feast fit for a Hobbit!

Looking forward to welcoming you to Bywater.

—From the folks at Weta Workshop Game Studio

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 map teases Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater announcement for March 4
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-map-teases-tony-hawks-pro-skater-announcement-for-march-4

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 revival seemingly inching ever closer.

A poster teasing a Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater announcement has been spotted in the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 multiplayer map “Grind,” which was added to the game today as part of its Season 02 update.

The poster features the date March 4, 2025 in the style of the Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 1 + 2 logo.

Professional skater Tyshawn Jones, who appeared in Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 1 + 2, recently said he will be in an upcoming Tony Hawk game.

Back in June 2022, Tony Hawk said that a Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4 was planned after Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 1 + 2, but plans were shelved after developer Vicarious Visions was absorbed by Blizzard Entertainment. At the time, Hawk said, “I wish there was someway to bring it back. I mean, who knows? Maybe when all the dust settles, we’ll figure it out.”

Thanks, CharlieIntel.
